events.name: Death of Marcus Aurelius
events.impact_description: The stable transition of power was disrupted, opening a new phase of imperial politics.
events.impact_on_following: Prepared the ground for Commodus’ accession and later systemic problems.

events.name: Commodus’ Reign and Assassination
events.impact_description: Severely damaged political trust and elite relations.
events.impact_on_following: Created the power vacuum that exploded in 193.

events.name: Murder of Pertinax, Auction of the Throne, and the Year of the Five Emperors
events.impact_description: Extreme political instability and loss of legitimacy.
events.impact_on_following: Enabled the rise of Septimius Severus and the Severan dynasty.

events.name: Founding of the Severan Dynasty
events.impact_description: Short-term stabilization combined with increased militarization.
events.impact_on_following: Raised the political power of the army in imperial succession.

events.name: Murder of Geta and Caracalla’s Sole Rule
events.impact_description: Strengthened autocracy and deepened elite fear.
events.impact_on_following: Accelerated fiscal strain and military favoritism.

events.name: Constitutio Antoniniana (Edict of Caracalla)
events.impact_description: Fundamental transformation of citizenship, law, and taxation.
events.impact_on_following: Reshaped fiscal and military recruitment structures.

events.name: Assassination of Caracalla and Short Reign of Macrinus
events.impact_description: Continued cycle of instability and short-lived emperors.
events.impact_on_following: Reinforced patterns of rapid regime turnover.

events.name: Reign of Elagabalus and Cultural–Religious Conflict
events.impact_description: Heightened cultural and religious tension.
events.impact_on_following: Provoked strong backlash from Senate and army.

events.name: Assassination of Severus Alexander and Onset of Crisis
events.impact_description: Direct trigger of the Third-Century Crisis.
events.impact_on_following: Marked the start of prolonged systemic instability.

events.name: Beginning of the Crisis of the Third Century
events.impact_description: Near-total breakdown of political, military, and economic stability.
events.impact_on_following: Led to fragmentation, fiscal collapse, and militarized rule.

events.name: Maximinus Thrax and Early Military Emperors
events.impact_description: Confirmed the army as the decisive political force.
events.impact_on_following: Institutionalized military dominance in succession.

events.name: Year of the Six Emperors
events.impact_description: Extreme fragmentation of imperial authority.
events.impact_on_following: Encouraged further regional power struggles.

events.name: Reign of Gordian III and Eastern Campaigns
events.impact_description: Relative stability under continuous military pressure.
events.impact_on_following: Maintained long-term eastern confrontation.

events.name: Philip the Arab and Rome’s 1000th Anniversary
events.impact_description: Symbolic cultural cohesion without structural reform.
events.impact_on_following: Short-lived stability before renewed crisis.

events.name: Battle of Abritus and Death of Decius
events.impact_description: First Roman emperor killed in battle against barbarians.
events.impact_on_following: Increased invasion pressure and instability.

events.name: Cyprianic Plague
events.impact_description: Severe demographic, economic, and military losses.
events.impact_on_following: Weakened imperial defense and production.

events.name: Battle of Edessa and Capture of Valerian
events.impact_description: Unprecedented capture of a Roman emperor.
events.impact_on_following: Accelerated imperial fragmentation in East and West.

events.name: Gallic Empire under Postumus
events.impact_description: Collapse of central authority in the Western provinces.
events.impact_on_following: Later reconquered by Aurelian.

events.name: Rise of Palmyra and Queen Zenobia
events.impact_description: Eastern secession weakened imperial unity.
events.impact_on_following: Provoked Aurelian’s reunification campaigns.

events.name: Aurelian Reunifies the Empire
events.impact_description: Restored territorial unity and imperial authority.
events.impact_on_following: Created conditions for later systemic reform.

events.name: Carausius and Allectus Breakaway in Britain
events.impact_description: Demonstrated vulnerability of distant provinces.
events.impact_on_following: Encouraged tighter frontier control reforms.

events.name: Accession of Diocletian and Imperial Reforms
events.impact_description: Fundamental restructuring of governance and authority.
events.impact_on_following: Founded the Late Roman imperial system.

events.name: Diocletianic Fiscal Reforms and Edict on Maximum Prices
events.impact_description: Attempted stabilization of inflation with mixed results.
events.impact_on_following: Shaped later fiscal and administrative norms.

events.name: Local Usurpations and Suppressions
events.impact_description: Accumulated regional instability.
events.impact_on_following: Justified stronger military-administrative control.

events.name: Diocletianic Persecution of Christians
events.impact_description: Heightened religious and social tensions.
events.impact_on_following: Strengthened Christian identity before legalization.

events.name: Death of Constantius Chlorus and Elevation of Constantine
events.impact_description: Opened the Constantine era.
events.impact_on_following: Triggered prolonged civil wars.

events.name: Battle of the Milvian Bridge
events.impact_description: Decisive victory reshaping imperial and religious policy.
events.impact_on_following: Accelerated Christian legalization.

events.name: Edict of Milan
events.impact_description: Legalization of Christianity.
events.impact_on_following: Established foundations for state-supported religion.

events.name: Constantine Defeats Licinius and Becomes Sole Emperor
events.impact_description: Completed imperial reunification.
events.impact_on_following: Enabled Constantinople and church–state integration.

events.name: Council of Nicaea, Constantinople Dedicated, and Death of Constantine
events.impact_description: Defined Christian orthodoxy and shifted imperial center eastward.
events.impact_on_following: Reshaped imperial succession and late Roman governance.
